fields.description:
Steps:
1. Setup JIRA 4.0 latest build.
2. After user has done all setup work, it says now you can login to JIRA.
3. Once user login to JIRA, he/she is taken to system dashboard.

Result:
1. Currently it show user some blank gadgets with lots of empty spaces.
2. Click the refresh icon of gadget and some text appears and spaces go away.

Expected:
1. The first time user experience should be much better then this.
fields.summary: Setting up JIRA show login user a dashboard having blank gadgets(plus blank spaces)

fields.description:
The use case is specifically running the quick search. e.g. "BAM Dependency Fixed Story ff:2.3" they'll get the JQL edit screen with a pretty complex JQL query in it. It's pretty tough to figure out if the search was the correct one. 

bq. project = 11011 AND (summary ~ Dependency OR description ~ Dependency OR comment ~ Dependency) AND issuetype = 16 AND resolution = 1 AND fixVersion in (14495, 14520, 14540, 14553, 14571, 14494, 14615, 14643, 14661, 14678, 14694, 14716, 14572)

Three suggestions:

# If it is possible use the "Simple" search, Display the query summary above the Search History !http://img.skitch.com/20090820-8tiq8durfhfxritwi5uykkacjg.png! Maybe the switch to simple link should be part of this section.
# If simple mode is not possible, the switch to simple mode should be replaced with a message saying the query is too complex for simple mode.
# The "Smart querying activated" box should have the original smart query in it. I've always wanted this, but I think it's even more important given that JQL parses the data into its most specific forms (ids)
fields.summary: JQL Searches should display parsed info from "View" tab when possible

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-18508].
  {panel}

Steps:
1. Download the standalone JIRA 4.0 build.
2. Start JIRA and in the setup screen, enter the expired evaluation license. 
3. Click "Next" to proceed to next page.

Result:
1. No error or warning message.
2. User can proceed with creation of user name and logging to JIRA.
3. Best part of all is that, once user login still there is no warning or error message. User can go and happily create project/user etc and when try to create issue...we give big message. It's surely fucking the customer.

Expected:
1. The least we can do here it to show a warning message before user proceed to next screen.
2. User should be directed to generate valid evaluation link.
fields.summary: User shouldn't be allowed to setup JIRA or update a license with expired evalution license key

fields.description: We need to ensure that portlets got converted correctly and that the gadgets display correctly.  We also need to check on the System Dashboard.
fields.summary: Create Tests for checking that portlets got converted to gadgets correctly
View & Edit Issue Improvements

fields.description: The Edit Component - Description field allows you to enter carriage returns, however, when the component description is displayed back to the user on the Project's Component pages the line breaks are not honored.  The text renders as-is, yet escapes any html tags, thus it is impossible to display a multi-line component description.
fields.summary: Component Description does not support multi-lines

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA
2. Try to access the menu drop downs using keyboard shortcuts.ex. click Alt+I to access issues tab.


Result:
1. Nothing get selected, till user press enter.
2. Till 3.13.5, clicking the shortcut selected the tab and then following enter take user to the option.
3. Currently in 4.0, its not giving any info to user and from usability point of view it sucks.

Expected:
1. Clicking shortcut should show the current focus.
2. Can we have browser specific tooltips. Currently on windows for both firefox and IE we show click Alt+<hot key> but in reality you need to click extra enter on IE and add <Shift> in FF.
fields.summary: It will be great if we can show the tab selected in IE once user click the shortcut button(before clicking enter)

fields.description: the integrity checker needs to ignore portlet configuration in the new world of gadgets
fields.summary: Disable Integrity checker checks for portlet configuration
Add link to Plugin Exchange to the Admin drop down

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. From the issues tab, select manage filters.
3. Select "Create new filter from current" or save a modified filter.
4. A save filter dialog will open.
5. Don't write any text or do any action. 
6. Click "Reload filter"(in case of modified filter) or manage tab for other cases.

Result:
1. User get warning message "you have data on page......"
2. It does n't happen if you click the links immediately but seems to be a time thing.

Expected:
1. User shouldn't be getting message if he/she has not enter any input in dialog
fields.summary: Clicking "reload filter" link without doing anything in "Save filter" give user warning message

fields.description:
See https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/~rwallace/2009/08/18/Our+RESTful+web+services+may+not+be+able+to+be+so+RESTful+after+all+-+and+it%27s+all+Googles+fault!

Validation calls via makeRequest() currently strip away the response body if the response code is anything but 200.
fields.summary: Change gadget validation REST endpoints to return 200 always and make the gadget framework handle these as errors

fields.description:
At the top of the plugins page in the admin screen - lets modify the text from

Plugins are used to extend the functionality of JIRA in different ways.  The Atlassian Plugin Exchange is a great place to download extra plugins contributed by the JIRA community.

To:

Visit the Atlassian Plugin Exchange to browse, download and read reviews about all the plugins you can install.

Link specifically to the JIRA plugins page - https://plugins.atlassian.com/search/by/jira

Before the word Atlassian - put the cog image we have already - talk to Sharpy we have a smaller version that Nick has used (NOT the one in the issue nav header drop down)
fields.summary: Plugins placement

fields.description: Currently we have multiple upgrade tasks that do a reindex.  We should probably get away with a single reindex for all 4.0 upgrade tasks, however we need to check that this wont break anything during the upgrade.
fields.summary: Remove any re-index from the JIRA 4.0 upgrade tasks that's not needed

* Go to an edit field in JIRA

* Type in some text

* Try to Select All with Ctrl-A

* The Admin menu is selected!
fields.summary: Ctrl A has been stolen by the Menu link guy.  Windows users are not going to be happy

fields.description:
steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Click on create issue link on top right corner.

Result.
1. The placement of create(button) and click(link) is not consistent with FF and Safari
2. Create button is on border line.

Expected:
1. The placement should be same across all browsers.
fields.summary: Placement of "Create" and "Cancel" in create issue dialog is not correct in IE
When a JIRA plugin is converted to plugins 2, component modules which implement Startable no longer have start() called

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Restore data from any of previous version of JIRA.
2. User is having some filters defined in database.
3. Login to JIRA, goto Manage filter. Click on any of the existing filter.
4. View the filter and click edit to view the filter.
5. The filter will be shown in simple/advanced view depending upon last selection of user.

Result:
1. In advanced view the query is shown with field values having ID's.
2. From a user point of view, it make now sense as when user has created them in simple navigator, he/she has used values in textual formats. Plus Id's hold no mean to user.

Expected:
1. The filters should be shown with values then with Id's
fields.summary: Filters created in earlier version of JIRA and upgraded to JIRA 4.0, show values in ID when open in JQL view.

fields.description: {{SimpleUserUtil}} fixes a circular dependency from the {{DefaultUserPickerSearchService}} via {{UserUtil}} to the {{SearchProvider}} back to the {{DefaultUserPickerSearchService}}. Unfortunately it complicates user functionality as there is a new interface and it should be removed and the dependency on the {{UserUtil}} from the {{DefaultUserPickerSearchService}} be injected via a different means such as a protected getter that can be overridden in the tests..
fields.summary: Rename or remove SimpleUserUtil

fields.description:
I wasted a couple of hours today trying to figure out why when I did a bulk move from one project to another all my component and version info was lost.

I first spent a long time making sure I had created matching components and versions in the target project.
After the move, all those values were lost.  I reread the documentation on bulk moves:
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.13.2/bulkoperations.html
I don't see a note in there that this almost certainly WON'T WORK.

There is also no indication from the UI itself this this probably WON'T WORK.

I had a hard time finding info about this in the Jira Forums as well.

Finally I discovered JRA-8248, a critical open issue that was opened nearly 4 years ago.

PLEASE update the UI and the documentation to indicate this probably WON'T WORK.
It is very misleading in the current state.
fields.summary: Update UI and Docs regarding misleading Retain Values on Bulk Move Issues

fields.description: I installed Jira 4.0 beta 2 on my local computer to test it out. After going through a full installation (including importing 3.12 data), I can successfully bring up the Jira web page with Internet Explorer 8.0. But, when I attempt to use Chrome 3.0.195.6, it's a mess. It appears a resource file is not being loaded properly. See the screenshots for an example.
fields.summary: Chrome doesn't work properly with 4.0b2

fields.description:
It's not happening all the time, but twice today I've created a new issue and lost the details entered. Frustrating.

There were a couple of lines in the description field and summary field was used.

Morgan Friberg also mentioned this as an issue on EACJ.
fields.summary: When creating an issue, the issue details is lost during create
When exporting to excel you get a field called "Images" with links to image file attachments.  Would like to have "Attachments" field which links to all attachments, not just images.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-18481].
  {panel}

See JRA-18480 for details on the problems that can arise when importing issues from CSV and setting the resolution inappropriately.  There needs to be a note made of the correct way to import unresolved issues.

If you have any unresolved issues in your CSV import, you will need to:
# Create a mapping for the resolution field
# Map the "UNRESOLVED" resolution to "Import as Blank"
fields.summary: Document how to handle unresolved issues in CSV Import

fields.description:
The issue navigator provides the ability to export a list of issues in excel format.  The output lists the resolution for all unresolved issues as "UNRESOLVED".

If you save the excel output to a CSV file and import it into JIRA, the "UNRESOLVED" resolution is not recognized for what it is.

If you make the mistake of adding an "UNRESOLVED" resolution, the imported issues won't show up on the project reports.  This happens because the project component and version reports on the project home page expect the resolution to be set to null rather than "UNRESOLVED".

The workaround is to map that resolution to "Import as Blank" manually.

Given that the information is going from our code (the excel export) to our code (the CSV import), the journey should be simpler.  As an example, during the import configuration wizard, the CSV file is parsed at least once.  That process could look for things like the "UNRESOLVED" resolution and suggest the necessary field mapping.

Adding an in-place warning when setting up the mapping for the resolution field would be a simpler approach.
fields.summary: Better handling of resolution field during CSV import

fields.description:
At first installation of Jira on the first configuration page appearing you see the words in bold:

"Wenn Sie ein Fertigungssystem verwenden, wird dringend empfohlen, diese Funktion zu aktivieren."

A german reader would never guess that "Fertigungssystem" here means a jira production system.
It reads more like:
"If you are making use of a manufacturing line it is strongly recommended to activate this function."

A software production system is just called "Produktionssystem".
fields.summary: Bad translation "Fertigungssystem" for production system

fields.description:
When typing a query into the Quick Search box, the search executes and returns the correct results, however there is no query filled in on the Advanced screen.

In 3.13.x (SAC), if you were to type the query "c:admin", it would do a search on components, without selecting any project (hence the component field would not be visible). In 4.0 now, we have the option of either continuing this behaviour, or displaying the Advanced screen.

Also, there are func tests that assert the behaviour of Quick Search, however they do not currently make good assertions about what the state of the issue navigator is afterwards.
fields.summary: Quick Search does not populate advanced query text box

In the "Issues" drop-down in the new header, "View you current issue filter" should read "View your current issue filter".  

SUGGESTION: maybe change to just "Find issues"?

{noformat}

fields.description:
Bulk move one or more bugs from one issue type to another.  There will be two entries for issue type in the change history tab and likewise two entries in the changeitem table in the database, one recorded as field=issue type and one recorded as field=type.  
Also see my comment here: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-17273?focusedCommentId=168071&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#action_168071
fields.summary: Bulk move of issue type creates duplicate entries in Change History

fields.description:
I'm using bulk-move and selecting the retain original value checkbox for the issue security level field.

The source and target projects have different Issue Security Schemes but some of the issue security levels are the same name.  For this specific issue, the security level is identical to the target level I want to assign to it.  The UI allows me to select the retain value checkbox, but after the move completes, the issue security level is set to None.

I've seen a similar issue reported about retaining version and component values.  Is this related?
fields.summary: Issue Security Level is not retained during bulk move
Have user peferences to allow user to automatically watch any issue user creates or votes for

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-18449].
  {panel}

Hello,

certain clients have difficulty interpreting empty tags in HTML emails and will format them incorrectly basically falling prey of the problem implied by paragraph [C.2|http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/#C_2] of the XHTML1.0 ref.

Editing the Velocity templates for HTML mail JIRA sends would help in this regard and shouldn't affect recent email client programs 

Best Regards,
Edoardo
fields.summary: HTML email templates should use backwards compatible tags

fields.description:
You can enter comments for each screenshots and attachments. Currently the comment will be displayed as normal comment. I think comments for screenshots/attachments should be positioned in the vicinity of these files, not as a normal comment...

Regards, Lars
fields.summary: Comments for screenshots or attachments

fields.description: All attachment handling inside JIRA goes over the AttachmentManager (create,delete,persistOnFileSystem and so on) but the "View Attachment" operation didn't make use of the AttachmentManager, it implements his own logic to deliver the attachment to the viewer inside ViewAttachmentServlet. This is not clear, if implementing an own AttachmentManager extenting the AttachmentManager through a Plugin is not enough, it is also necessary to override/change the ViewAttachmentServlet, but extending JIRA doesn't have to require code changes to JIRA CodeBase.
fields.summary: Change ViewAttachmentServlet to make use of AttachmentManager

fields.description:
Currently the extras licensing code has System.out prinln statements in it IF you enter an invalid license (as in undecodeable one).

Sam has fixed this but not released the new lib version.  We should upgrade before 4.0 ships.

If this doesnt get done its a minor issue because it only affects peoiple who type in un decodeable license strings.  It does not happen for valid V1 license strings

fields.description:
See eg GHS-1394 for problems it causes.

FieldVisibilityBean is a webwork bean which means it must be a concrete class, which makes it unusable by Spring dependency injection for Plugins 2 plugins.
We should deprecate use of FieldVisibilityBean as an injected component and provide a FieldVisibilityService (or similar) with appropriate interface.
fields.summary: Remove use of FieldVisibilityBean as an injected dependency - it doesn't work with plugins2
fix broken gadget selenium tests
review gadget upgrade tasks

fields.description:
This should not happen.

When you use a function, any of its values should only report that the values that came from function were not cool, do not create one per value.

We can do this by adding a field to the QueryLiteral that indicates where it came from via an Enum : SingleValue or Function

Then if the QueryLiteral came from the function we know to add the function error message.

We need to change all the validators to handle this, it should not be too much work since they are already doing most of this.
fields.summary: When you use a function within a list you will get error messages for each value in the function that is not cool for use with the field

fields.description: During the gadget work, all the portlet.* i18n keys were copied into gadgets.* equivalents. The English translation for the key was updated and so the Gadgets all render correctly in English. All other languages that have translations for the portlet original keys must be copied to the new gadget equivalent in order to preserve the translations in the 4.0 gadget versions of the portlets.
fields.summary: All portlet i18n keys need their non English translations copied to the gadget equivalents.

Validation errors from the consumer are not handled correctly when recevied by the consumer app

fields.description:
Quick search returns all issues if Quick Search fails to find issues matching specified criteria.

e.g If i search for a component "testcomp" using quick search "c:testcomp". In case there is no matching component, search returns all issues. This result is misleading. If no match is found, then search result should return "No issues found."
fields.summary: JIRA Quick Search returns all issues when no match found

fields.description:
Installed clean jira 4-beta2. This works fine and everything is functional.
Then did an import from a backup of our jira 3.13 server.
After this, the dashboard login gadget displays i18n keys instead of values.
If you try to actually login using the gadget, it re-deriects to a very blank screen containing the same broken looking gadget.
From this point, if you simply hit the base jira url again, you are in-fact logged in.

Also, if you click the Login link in the navbar instead of using the gadget, everything works properly.
After logging in, all gadgets seem to be fine.

I've attached 2 screenshots of the broken interfaces.
fields.summary: Login gadget broken after import

fields.description:
We need to look at what JIRA does when the initialization of a searcher throws a Runtime exception. At the moment it stop JRIA from starting with a huge exception. This happend because we were trying to load an old version a plugin. This results in a RuntimeException that we did not deal with very well.

What does JIRA do when a custom field plugin is removed from the classpath?
fields.summary: Need to look at hardening JIRA when RuntimeExceptions occur during searcher initialisation.

fields.description: We should really make all our user profile pages use the new atl.userprofile decorator.
fields.summary: Cleanup userprofile pages to use the new atl.userprofile decorator

fields.description:
The DashboardMenu selenium test causes a deadlock in pico when reloading data, most likely because it's firing a REST request while data is being loaded. In theory johnson is meant to prevent this from happening but it doesn't seem to be working correctly.

Need to fix this.  Test commented out for now so the rest of the tests can run!
fields.summary: DashboardMenu Selenium test causes deadlock

fields.description:
The tooltip on the permlink icon in the issue nav should be similar to what we have on the tooltip in the comment section.

"A permanent link to this search"
fields.summary: Tooltip on permlink in issue nav could be better

fields.description:
{noformat}
2009-08-13 15:26:02,109 http-8090-Processor8 INFO anonymous 52614x25x1 19v1v4w /secure/SetupImport.jspa [atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl] Performing Upgrade Task: Converts Legacy Portlets to Gadgets including user preferences.
org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: Unknown Types value.
	at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.setNull(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:1094)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc3.AbstractJdbc3Statement.setNull(AbstractJdbc3Statement.java:1447)
	at org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.dbcp.DelegatingPreparedStatement.setNull(DelegatingPreparedStatement.java:105)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.setValue(SQLProcessor.java:903)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.setValue(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:787)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.bulkUpdateByPrimaryKey(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:520)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build410.doUpgrade(UpgradeTask_Build410.java:78)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl.doUpgradeTaskSucess(UpgradeManagerImpl.java:478)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl.runUpgradeTasks(UpgradeManagerImpl.java:398)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl.doUpgrade(UpgradeManagerImpl.java:335)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl.doUpgradeIfNeeded(UpgradeManagerImpl.java:286)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl.doUpgradeIfNeededAndAllowed(UpgradeManagerImpl.java:243)
	at com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.DataImport.doExecute(DataImport.java:241)
{noformat}

This is caused by the fact that NULL is being set as the value with the JDBC {{Types.JAVA_OBJECT}} (as it can't determine in this case that it should be a VARCHAR as it's null). Some JDBC drivers don't like this and complain.

In this case, simply using empty string suffices, as the application handles empty string as though it was null.
fields.summary: Upgrade Task 410 can throw weird exceptions on Postgres/Oracle
Gadgets appear blank in Internet Explorer when using oauth

fields.description: See https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AG-858
fields.summary: Missing values for i18n keys result in empty strings on a gadget's configuration page.
Bugzilla gadget requires oauth in refapp when logged in
Admin gadget shows up some admin links when accessed anonymously from refapp without logging in
Time-since gadget shows an additional bar for today even though all issues were created yesterday.
Allow user to undo an approved oauth in gadgets
Bugzilla gadget requires oauth in refapp when logged in
Query syntax help (? icon) should open new window when clicked not override current search window

fields.description: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching?clicked=jirahelp#AdvancedSearching-Parent%C2%B9
fields.summary: Need to add quotes around issue key in Parent query example
JQL autocomplete should require a space between the in operator and the next value
assigned-to-me and in-progress gadgets do not display what are the default columns in the config field description. The original portlets did.

fields.description: This would be helpful when you get error messages that contain this information.
fields.summary: It would be cool if there was a JS thing on JQL entry that showed the current line number and column number of your cursor

fields.description: This is by design, since I think it would be confusing to see it in all the places you can use it but if we think we would like this it can be fixed.
fields.summary: JQL autocomplete never suggests the NOT operator

fields.description: reserved words like select still show green tick e.g. "assignee = select" shows green, but doesn't parse when run
fields.summary: JQL autocomplete still thinks your string parses for some reserved words
JQL autocomplete does not always correctly handle new lines correctly

fields.description:
If you some how manage to run the invalid query "key is one-1", then JIRA will return the issue with key 'ONE-1'. It seems that the query generator does not check to ensure that the passed clause is valid before generating the query. This should not be a user visible problem because the validation ensures that the user cannot enter in such a query.

This might also be a problem with some other fields. Need to check them.

Not a show stopper for 4.0.
fields.summary: The Issue Key ClauseFactory does not validate the clause before generating a query.
JQL autocomplete in Firefox when you try to replace a portion of some queries it replaces all the way to the end of the query

fields.description:
If you type a field that is not a text field you still get the ~ and !~ operators suggested, it would be nice if you only got them when they were valid.

Not sure if we want to fix this, it would be cool but we probably could live without it.
fields.summary: JQL autocomplete it would be cool if you were not suggested operators that do not fit with the field typed
Preference descriptions in the configuration for Voted Gadget is too long and looks messed up.

fields.description:
When using the Mac international key entry software when you complete your Japanese character it does not send a keyDown event.

This has the effect of not firing the JS for autocomplete. If you arrow right then it triggers the JS. 

Perhaps we need to trigger off of another event.
fields.summary: JQL autocomplete does not trigger the autocomplete JS when entering a Japanese character

fields.description:
We should probably deal with other locale's versions of these characters.

Not sure if we need to fix this in the autocomplete but we should fix it in the real parser.
fields.summary: The JQL parser (auto complete and Antlr) do not deal with the "=", "<" when entered in as Japanese characters.

fields.description:
We show the first 15 suggestions and do not indicate that there are more available.

This was the suggestion of our UI team, not sure if we need to address this.
fields.summary: JQL autocomplete should indicate that there are more completions in the dropdown

fields.description: This is inconsistent, when you are suggested Logical Operators, operators, and order by fields you get the initial list after one space, this should be the same way for field suggestions.
fields.summary: JQL autocomplete to get an initial list of field suggestions you need to type 2 spaces

fields.description:
If you are typing a version called Version1, currently you will be suggested that value until you have fully typed in Version1, then the suggestion will go away.

Brad would prefer the behavior of leaving the suggestion up as confirmation that you have indeed correctly typed the value.
fields.summary: JQL autocomplete some people feel it would be cool if the autocomplete left as a suggestion your fully typed value
JQL autocomplete it would be nice if when editing an existing query we did not suggest ORDER BY when it will make the query invalid

fields.description:
When using the in or not in operators we suggest only functions taht will work with a list AND we suggest single values that will not actually work unless you surround them with ( ).

It would be nice if for the first single value you could also complete an opening (
fields.summary: JQL autocomplete it would be cool if when using the in operator you were suggested ( instead of suggesting the values

fields.description:
When trying to complete a user or version or whatever if you type the query value inside a " it works as expected, if instead you type a ' it does not complete.

Single quote should behave the same as double quote when it is the first quote encountered.
fields.summary: JQL autocomplete single quotes are not treated the same as a double quote

fields.description:
* the query valid/invalid icon does not show
* there is empty space between starting point and value in the suggestions list

I think this is an IE bug, not sure if we need to fix it since it is IE6, works on IE7 and IE8.
fields.summary: JQL autocomplete on IE6 there are some rendering bugs

fields.description: We should not suggest the currentUser function if the user is not logged in.
fields.summary: JQL autocomplete the currentUser() function is shown when you are logged out

fields.description: Though it is very unlikely, it's possible that modz detector can use excessive temporary RAM when there are large files in the distribution. Also see https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/MODZ-2
fields.summary: Excessive memory consumption by modz detector in System Info page (first hit)

fields.description:
When I click on a fix version the JQL i see on the issue navigator contains the project field twice.  This means that I cannot switch back to simple editing without manually removing one of the project fields.

resolution is EMPTY AND project = 11771 AND *project = 11771* AND fixVersion = 14692 ORDER BY status DESC, key DESC
fields.summary: JQL generated when you click on a fix version in the Issue Statistics gadget could be better
